item.title: Erich add a quote by Annie Dillard
item.description: "Similarly, the impulse to keep to yourself what you have learned is not only shameful, it is destructive. Anything you do not give freely and abundantly becomes lost to you. You open your safe and find ashes." -- Annie Dillard

item.title: Erich add a quote by Richard Adams
item.description: "Many human beings say that they enjoy the winter, but what they really enjoy is feeling proof against it." -- Richard Adams

item.title: Erich add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Erich add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "A house divided against itself cannot stand." I believe this government cannot endure, permanently half slave and half free. I do not expect the Union to be dissolved — I do not expect the house to fall — but I do expect it will cease to be divided. It will become all one thing or all the other." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Erich add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "All this happened, more or less." -- Kurt Vonnegut
